alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, southwestern Henry, southeastern Coffee, northeastern Geneva and western Houston Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 624 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blue Springs State Park to near Newton to near Hartford. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Abbeville, Headland, Dothan, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Enterprise, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Slocomb, Newton, Webb, Ariton, Pinckard, Malvern, Rehobeth and Clayhatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
